bibl.title: Dispatch from Robert Cunningham to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

correspAction.roleName: Acting U.S. Commercial Agent for Loanda

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

opener.dateline:
United States Commercial Agency
at Loanda 30th June 1862

div1.p: I have the honor to inform you that Silas Andrews Esq the newly appointed Commercial Agent has not yet arrived. In consequence of this Gentlemans non-arrival I beg to solicit the appointment as Vice Commercial Agent so as to enable me to be officially acknowledged by the Government of His Most Faithful Majesty, which I have not as yet been.

By the non-appearance here of the Commercial Agent I still hold the office as Acting, it therefore would be very necessary to be informed, whether the above named Gentleman has taken the office
The Honble W. H. Seward Secretary of State Washington D.C. &c &c &c
office to which he is appointed and of his intentions in coming

closer.signed:
Robert Cunningham
Actg U.S. Coml Agt
